title: The Ratings Game: Disney joins Netflix and Amazon as a streaming leader with new subscription service
first_para: Walt Disney Co. has joined the ranks of the direct-to-consumer streaming giants Netflix Inc. and Amazon.com Inc. with the launch of Disney+, analysts say.

title: Market Snapshot: Stock futures point slightly higher as China growth steadies, earnings roll in
first_para:
Shares of Netflix Inc.
NFLX, +1.58%

                            
                                  
      
      
      
      
      
      
      
                                         were down 1.3% after whipsawing following the release of its first-quarter earnings late Tuesday. The company announced a record number of subscribers, but issued guidance for the second quarter that some have interpreted as disappointing.

title: Earnings Watch: Netflix is already over Apple and Disney as it prepares to launch this quarter’s earnings
first_para: Netflix Inc. is being targeted by two deep-pocketed new rivals, but it prepared for questions about how that could affect its business by changing its definition of “competition” in advance.

title: Netflix's CEO Reed Hastings to leave Facebook's board
first_para:
Reed Hastings, chairman and chief executive of Netflix Inc. 

                            
                            
                                  
      
      
      
      
      
      
      
                                  
                                    NFLX, +1.58%

                            
                                  
      
      
      
      
      
      
      
                                         will be leaving Facebook Inc.'s 

                            
                            
                                  
      
      
      
      
      
      
      
                                  
                                    FB, -0.28%

                            
                                  
      
      
      
      
      
      
      
                                         board along with Erskine Bowles, president emeritus of University of North Carolina, the social media company said Friday. The company also nominated Peggy Alford, senior vice president of core markets at PayPal Holdings Inc. 

                            
                            
                                  
      
      
      
      
      
      
      
                                  
                                    PYPL, -1.33%

                            
                                  
      
      
      
      
      
      
      
                                         for election to the board at its annual meeting on May 30. Other current members of the board include Facebook CEO Mark Zuckerberg, Sheryl Sandberg, Facebook's chief operating officer, and Peter Thiel of Founders Fund. Facebook shares rose 0.9% to close at $179.10.

title: Stocks open higher after upbeat corporate earnings
first_para:
Stocks rose at the opening bell on Wednesday as investors keyed into the next round of first-quarter corporate earnings, while showing little interest in China's robust economic data. The S&P 500 

                            
                            
                                  
      
      
      
      
      
      
      
                                  
                                    SPX, +0.16%

                            
                                  
      
      
      
      
      
      
      
                                         was up 0.3% to 2,916. The Dow Jones Industrial Average 

                            
                            
                                  
      
      
      
      
      
      
      
                                  
                                    DJIA, +0.42%

                            
                                  
      
      
      
      
      
      
      
                                         picked up 32 points, or 0.1%, to 26,484. The Nasdaq Composite 

                            
                            
                                  
      
      
      
      
      
      
      
                                  
                                    COMP, +0.02%

                            
                                  
      
      
      
      
      
      
      
                                         climbed 0.6% to 8,046. Key equity benchmarks continue to move toward their record highs, with the S&P 500 less than 1% away from its all-time closing high on Sept. 20. China's economy grew 6.4% on a yearly basis in the first-quarter, thanks to a rebound in industrial activity. In company news, shares of Netflix Inc. 

                            
                            
                                  
      
      
      
      
      
      
      
                                  
                                    NFLX, +1.58%

                            
                                  
      
      
      
      
      
      
      
                                         rose in pre-market trading after the entertainment firm said it attracted close to 10 million subscribers in its first-quarter results.

title: Netflix stock gains after Deutsche Bank upgrades to buy ahead of earnings
first_para:
Netflix Inc. 

                            
                            
                                  
      
      
      
      
      
      
      
                                  
                                    NFLX, +1.58%

                            
                                  
      
      
      
      
      
      
      
                                         shares are up 1.6% in premarket trading Tuesday after Deutsche Bank's Bryan Kraft upgraded the stock to buy from hold. Netflix is scheduled to report first-quarter earnings after the close. Kraft sees room for the company to beat subscriber expectations for 2019 to 2020, calling the consensus forecast too conservative. He also argued that Netflix is "looking more and more like a platform every day, rather than just an application." Netflix's platform status helps retain customers for longer and makes the service more attractive to "talent" in the media world. The company also has an opportunity to "improve the efficiency and effectiveness of its content spend," according to Kraft, who argued that Netflix has been a bit too liberal about going forward with shows. The stock has lost 0.7% over the past three months, as the S&P 500 

                            
                            
                                  
      
      
      
      
      
      
      
                                  
                                    SPX, +0.16%

                            
                                  
      
      
      
      
      
      
      
                                         has gained 11%.

title: Disney's stock surge to a record adds 80 points to Dow industrials, offsetting Chevron's 40-point drag
first_para:
Shares of Walt Disney Co. 

                            
                            
                                  
      
      
      
      
      
      
      
                                  
                                    DIS, +0.53%

                            
                                  
      
      
      
      
      
      
      
                                         surged 11% Friday morning, delivering the lion's share of early gains for the Dow Jones Industrial Average. Disney's stock was trading at an all-time high at around $129 after announcing a video-streaming package that could compete with the likes of Netflix Inc. 

                            
                            
                                  
      
      
      
      
      
      
      
                                  
                                    NFLX, +1.58%

                            
                                  
      
      
      
      
      
      
      
                                         boosting demand for the entertainment giant's stock and providing a fillip to the Dow, where it is a component. Disney's share gain of $12 equates to a more than 80-point rise in the price-weighted Dow 

                            
                            
                                  
      
      
      
      
      
      
      
                                  
                                    DJIA, +0.42%

                            
                                  
      
      
      
      
      
      
      
                                         where an advance of a $1 in any one component translates to roughly 6.8-point swing. That gain was more than offsetting a decline in shares of Chevron Corp. 

                            
                            
                                  
      
      
      
      
      
      
      
                                  
                                    CVX, -0.34%

                            
                                  
      
      
      
      
      
      
      
                                         which was under pressure after the energy giant announced a $33 billion bid to buy Anadarko Petroleum Corp. 

                            
                            
                                  
      
      
      
      
      
      
      
                                  
                                    APC, +0.23%

                            
                                  
      
      
      
      
      
      
      
                                         in a cash-and-stock deal. Chevron's shares were off $6.49, or 5.2%, at $119.42, with that decline exacting a roughly 40-point toll on the Dow. Meanwhile, the S&P 500 index 

                            
                            
                                  
      
      
      
      
      
      
      
                                  
                                    SPX, +0.16%

                            
                                  
      
      
      
      
      
      
      
                                         and the Nasdaq Composite Index 

                            
                            
                                  
      
      
      
      
      
      
      
                                  
                                    COMP, +0.02%

                            
                                  
      
      
      
      
      
      
      
                                         were trading solidly higher in a broad-market rally on the back of the Chevron merger announcement and a round of bank earnings, including from JPMorgan Chase & Co. 

                            
                            
                                  
      
      
      
      
      
      
      
                                  
                                    JPM, -0.73%

                            
                                  
      
      
      
      
      
      
      
                                         and Wells Fargo & Co. 

                            
                            
                                  
      
      
      
      
      
      
      
                                  
                                    WFC, +0.06%

title: Netflix to add production hub in NYC and create 127 new jobs
first_para:
Netflix Inc. 

                            
                            
                                  
      
      
      
      
      
      
      
                                  
                                    NFLX, +1.58%

                            
                                  
      
      
      
      
      
      
      
                                         is planning to add a production hub to its new York City operations, adding up to $100 million in investments to he city and hundred of jobs, Gov. Andrew Cuomo said Thursday. The hub will include an expanded office with 127 high-paying jobs in content, marketing and production over the next five years, he said. The streaming giant will add six sound stages in Brooklyn with the capacity for thousands of production crew jobs. Netflix's new corporate offices are expected to occupy about 100,000 square feet in the Flatiron District. The company has already produced many shows in New York City, including the women's prison series "Orange is the New Black," comedy series "Unbreakable Kimmy Schmidt," as well as The Martin Scorcese-helmed film "The Irishman." It has leased about 161,000 square feet of space at Johnson Ave. in Brooklyn. The company will receive up to $4 million tax credits over then years, directly tied to job creation. The news comes after Amazon.com Inc. 

                            
                            
                                  
      
      
      
      
      
      
      
                                  
                                    AMZN, -0.17%

                            
                                  
      
      
      
      
      
      
      
                                         cancelled plans to locate part of its second headquarters in Long Island City, Queens, after opposition from locals to the billions of dollars it was set to receive from the state. Netflix shares were up 1.3% on Thursday, and have gained 34% in 2019 so far, while the S&P 500 

                            
                            
                                  
      
      
      
      
      
      
      
                                  
                                    SPX, +0.16%

                            
                                  
      
      
      
      
      
      
      
                                         has gained 16%.

                                         closed up 1% at 26,412, finishing mostly flat for the week. The S&P 500 index 

                            
                            
                                  
      
      
      
      
      
      
      
                                  
                                    SPX, +0.16%

                            
                                  
      
      
      
      
      
      
      
                                         gained 0.7% to end at 2,907, while the Nasdaq Composite Index 

                            
                            
                                  
      
      
      
      
      
      
      
                                  
                                    COMP, +0.02%

                            
                                  
      
      
      
      
      
      
      
                                         finished the session up 0.5% at 7,984. Both the S&P 500 and Nasdaq registered weekly gains of at least 0.5%. All three benchmarks are within 2% of their all-time highs. An announced merger between Chevron Corp. 

                            
                            
                                  
      
      
      
      
      
      
      
                                  
                                    CVX, -0.34%

                            
                                  
      
      
      
      
      
      
      
                                         and Anadarko Petroleum Corp. 

                            
                            
                                  
      
      
      
      
      
      
      
                                  
                                    APC, +0.23%

                            
                                  
      
      
      
      
      
      
      
                                         also colored market sentiment green before the start of regular trade Friday.

title: Netflix reports record subscriber gains, but forecast hurts stock
first_para: Netflix Inc. attracted a record number of paying subscribers in the first quarter of 2019, a fact that would usually coincide with huge gains for its stock, but concerns about the rest of the year actually damaged shares Tuesday afternoon.

title: Dementia can be prevented but doctors and families are handling it all wrong, says this expert
first_para:
“That experience galvanized me to help, to make it my personal and professional mission to identify people who may be at risk for dementia, and help provide alternatives,” he said. DenBoer created Smart Brain Aging, a cognitive intervention company with an in-person clinic in Scottsdale, Ariz., and an online program. He is now also a director and producer behind a new film called “This is Dementia,” to be released on May 1 and available on Netflix. 

                            
                            
                                  
      
      
      
      
      
      
      
                                  
                                    NFLX, +1.58%

title: Jeff Reeves's Strength in Numbers: The 5 biggest questions about Netflix’s earnings
first_para: Given the run for many stocks in 2019, it’s no wonder that “risk-on” names in technology are getting plenty of consideration. But as Netflix approaches a make-it-or-break it earnings report, the streaming video giant is at the center of attention.

title: Disney launches $7 streaming service, but will Netflix fans go for it?
first_para: It adds to a coterie of streaming services, including Netflix, Hulu, Apple TV and Amazon Prime. Netflix, for instance, has global hits like “The Crown,” and critical successes like “Russian Doll” and “Stranger Things,” “Black Mirror” and “Orange is the New Black.”

title: Beyonce just one-upped her own Netflix documentary with a surprise live Coachella album
first_para:
The unannounced album was released on Apple Music, Spotify and Google Play (compared with some recent releases that were initially exclusive to her husband Jay-Z’s streaming service Tidal) ahead of her Netflix 

                            
                            
                                  
      
      
      
      
      
      
      
                                  
                                    NFLX, +1.58%

                            
                                  
      
      
      
      
      
      
      
                                          documentary, “Homecoming: A Film by Beyonce,” also released Wednesday. The doc gives a behind-the-scenes look at her Coachella performances; the first time an African-American woman had headlined the festival held in the California desert over two weekends each April.

title: 5 clichés about millennials that may be wrong — starting with their student-loan debt
first_para:
OK, so baby boomers didn’t spend their money on Apple’s iPhones 

                            
                            
                                  
      
      
      
      
      
      
      
                                  
                                    AAPL, +0.36%

                            
                                  
      
      
      
      
      
      
      
                                         or Netflix

                                         streaming services when they were 30, because neither of those things existed. But overall the spending differences between millennials and previous generations have been grossly exaggerated.

title: How the Disney-Netflix streaming war will create collateral damage
first_para:
Streaming incumbent and growth icon Netflix
